description:
The novel series centers on a young girl who fights on the frontlines in war. She has blonde hair, blue eyes, and nearly transparent white skin, and she flies through the air and mercilessly strikes down her opponents. Her name is Tanya Degurechaff, and she speaks with a young girl's lisp and commands the army. Tanya used to be one of Japan's elite office workers, but because of a wrathful god, was reborn as a little girl. Tanya prioritizes optimization and career advancement above all, and she will become the most dangerous entity among the Imperial Army's sorcerers.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Tanks
tags.description: Prominently features the use of tanks or other armoured vehicles.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://x.com/sonzaix) | [Note](https://note.com/sonzaix) | [Blog](http://sonzaix.blog.fc2.com) | [Syosetu](https://mypage.syosetu.com/mypage/profile/userid/278115)

Zen released ['Youjo Senki'](https://anilist.co/manga/94846/Youjo-Senki/) the 31th of October 2013, which jumpstarted their career due to the success of the light novel. The series would later be adapted to [manga](https://anilist.co/manga/97216/Youjo-Senki/), [anime](https://anilist.co/anime/21613/Youjo-Senki/) and a [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/100878/Youjo-Senki-Movie/). The novel and manga are being translated into English by [Yen Press](https://yenpress.com/series/the-saga-of-tanya-the-evil-manga).

The author also participated in scenario writing for the game adaptation of  __'Chaos Dragon: Chaos War'__ and the original story creator of __'Jyūma no Reza Nation'__.

They love Humanities and Social Science, especially when associated with International Relations and History, which might have played a huge role in the creation of Youjo Senki in the first place. They're a huge fan of simulation and strategy games, especially Paradox Interactive's. They're also a [Toshiya Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/119353/Toshiya-Wakabayashi) fan, the original creator of [Tsurezure Children](https://anilist.co/anime/98291/Tsurezure-Children/).

The author often jokingly says they're not good at deadlines or they're a pastafarian and caffeine addict.

MYTH & ROID is a musical unit consisting of music producer [Tom-H@ck](https://anilist.co/staff/107596/Tomohiro-Oshima), lyricist [hotaru](https://anilist.co/staff/150361/hotaru), and vocalist [KIHOW](https://anilist.co/staff/220691/). In 2017, the original vocalist, Mayu Maeshima, left the unit and was replaced by KIHOW.

**Height:** 145 cm (4'9")
**Nicknames:** Ao-chan (あおちゃん), Kodomo sensei (こども先生, lit. Child teacher)
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)
- Renne Bright - Eiyuu Densetsu: Sen no Kiseki IV (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Hajimari no Kiseki (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Kuro no Kiseki (VG)
- Yurusen - Kamen Rider Ghost (VG)
- Fiona - Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (VG)
- Rita Rossweisse - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Moddey - Memento Mori (VG)
- Futaba Sakura - Persona 5/Royal (VG)
- Pascal - NieR: Automata (VG) (VG)
- Nian - Arknights (VG)
- Istina - Arknights (VG)
- Ravi & Apocalyptic Ravi - Epic 7 (VG)
- Schneider - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lysithea - Fire Emblem: Three Houses (VG)
- Cinderella - Nikke: Goddess of Victory (VG)
- Sugar - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).
